key_risks: Regulatory risks due to potential changes in Medicare and Medicaid reimbursement rates
Tenant concentration risk with reliance on a limited number of operators
Labor shortages in skilled nursing and senior housing sectors
Economic sensitivity to rising interest rates and inflation
Analyst downgrades and reduced market sentiment
controversies: Recent downgrade by Wedbush from Neutral to Underperform
Lowered average 12-month price target by analysts
environmental_issues: Incorporating ESG considerations, including energy-efficient property upgrades
social_issues: Labor shortages impacting tenant performance and occupancy rates
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and financial difficulties faced by major tenants

sources.title: Fitch Affirms CareTrust REIT at 'BB+'; Outlook Stable - Fitch Ratings
sources.snippet: Fitch Ratings - New York - 24 May 2024: Fitch Ratings has affirmed the ratings of CareTrust REIT, Inc. (NYSE: CTRE), its operating subsidiary CTR Partnership L.P., and financing subsidiary CareTrust Capital Corp., including Long-Term Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) at 'BB+' and unsecured debt ratings at 'BB+'/'RR4'. The Rating Outlook is Stable.
